parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: A primary verb; to convince; by analogy, to pacify or conciliate; reflexively or passively, to assent, to rely.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
The conscience, a persisting notion. From a prolonged form of suneido; co-perception, i.e. Moral consciousness.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: From ana and strepho; to overturn; also to return; by implication, to busy oneself, i.e. Remain, live.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
